intro: Mentzelia nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Mentzelia nelsonii is part of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native range.
